meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring high temperatures, especially by measuring the radiation emitted by a hot body.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used pyrometers to check how hot the metal was.
meanings.sent2: The technician relied on pyrometers to monitor the furnace temperature.
meanings.sent3: The pyrometers at the lab were so accurate, they could even measure the heat of a dragon's breath!
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like pyrometers, always able to gauge the intensity of a situation.
meanings.sent5: The pyrometers glowed red as they detected the heat from the blazing fire.

meanings.definition: A device used to measure the temperature of an object by means of the radiation it emits.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used pyrometers to determine the heat of the engine.
meanings.sent2: Pyrometers are commonly used in industrial settings to ensure safety.
meanings.sent3: The pyrometers in the kitchen were so sensitive, they could tell if the soup was too hot to handle.
meanings.sent4: His words were like pyrometers, revealing the underlying emotions through subtle cues.
meanings.sent5: The pyrometers beeped loudly, indicating a sudden spike in temperature.
